meanings.definition: Give the right to vote to
meanings.sent1: The new law enfranchising all citizens was celebrated by the community.
meanings.sent2: The government is enfranchising more people to ensure fair elections.
meanings.sent3: Enfranchising everyone made the voting process much more exciting.
meanings.sent4: Enfranchising the population breathed new life into the democratic system.
meanings.sent5: She felt empowered after enfranchising her fellow citizens.

meanings.sent1: The company enfranchised several new branches across the country.
meanings.sent2: The organization is enfranchising local businesses to expand its reach.
meanings.sent3: Enfranchising the small town with a new franchise brought joy to the residents.
meanings.sent4: The decision to enfranchise the startup was a game-changer for its growth.
meanings.sent5: He enfranchised his loyal employees with ownership shares.

meanings.definition: Endow with the rights of citizenship, especially the right to vote
meanings.sent1: The constitution enfranchises all individuals with equal voting rights.
meanings.sent2: Enfranchising immigrants is a crucial step towards inclusivity.
meanings.sent3: Enfranchising aliens from outer space would make for an interesting election.
meanings.sent4: The idea of enfranchising animals in a zoo sparked a heated debate.
meanings.sent5: She believed in enfranchising every member of society for a stronger democracy.
